text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Northern District | translit_lang1 = - | translit_lang1_type1 = Hebrew | translit_lang1_info1 = | translit_lang1_type = Arabic | translit_lang1_info = | type = District of Israel | image_map = Northern District in Israel (undisputed).svg | mapsize = 150px | map_caption = | subdivision_type = Cities | subdivision_name = 17 | subdivision_type1 = Local Councils | subdivision_name1 = 61 | subdivision_type2 = Regional Councils | subdivision_name2 = 15 | seat_type = Capital | seat = Nof HaGalil | seat1_type = Largest | seat1 = Nazareth | area_total_km2 = 4,478 | population_total = 1,401,300 | population_as_of = 2016 | iso_code = IL-Z }} The Northern District (, Minṭaqat ash-Shamāl; , Meḥoz HaTzafon) is one of the six districts of Israel. The capital is Nof HaGalil and the largest city is Nazareth. It has an area of . In 2016, 1,401,300 people lived there. Category:Northern District (Israel)
title: Northern District (Israel)
